Articles.Content: Now that KSP is in a "finished" state (1.0) do you have plans for any more games, or is KSP going to be the only one? Yes, I understand you will continue to improve, update, and add content to KSP... but I'm gonna go out on a limb and guess it won't be as hard-core as before release.

We're still focussed 100% on KSP and indeed plan to continue updating it even after 1.0. With the success KSP already is, and the amazing ride games development has been it makes sense to develop more games in the future, but there's no plans to develop sequels for KSP or develop another game at the moment ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I don't see why they wouldn't keep developing games. They've proven that they have a capable and talented team... they've got a fan base who's probably willing to test and fund whatever their next creation is... it's clear that KSP, their first-ever game, has been a huge hit (and probably generated a LOT of money for them)

The thing I'm worried about is if KSP's success was, you know, a luck-based thing. Not completely luck, but maybe it was just a wild chance that people liked this concept of building rockets.

It'll probably be fine though. Hopefully they can figure out what it was that made KSP successful and then the next one will be even better!

Okay, here's another question for SQUAD.

Have you guys decided to drop The Daily Kerbal?

Happy landings!
I find Squad to have the same following and business model as Mojang. The probably will make a few more games, but they will never reach KSP level.

Can we expect to see Kerbal Theme Park, an expansion to KSP that allows you to build and manage your own theme park... in space. Or perhaps Kerbal City, a game where you build a colony on Duna and brave the harsh environment. Perhaps even World of K-Syndrome; a game filled with Kliche Kerbal Kadness and Everything begins with K.
